Plasmodium berghei strain B (
Pb B) (MRA-406, MR4, ATCC® Manassas Virginia) was obtained from BEI Resources ( https://www.beiresources.org) and used for the experiments. A cryopreserved parasite was thawed and injected intraperitoneally (i.p.) into naïve recipient mice. Three days after infection, the parasitemia was monitored daily in tail vein blood through Giemsa-stained thin smear observation under oil immersion at 100x magnification. Passage of infection in new mice consisted of an i.p. injection of 200 μL of 10 6 infected erythrocytes/mL sterile PBS [ 20].
